title: Geoffrey Bradfield "Millennium Modern" book cover type
content:
anyone know this font? i don’t think its a hard one, but i can’t seem to nail it.

thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145715im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/fontexample_5492.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Sun Microsystems modern sans - Sun {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145715/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36830 "Go to previous forum topic") ["The Book Of The Damned" condensed display sans from 60s book cover ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145715/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36836 "Go to next forum topic")
author: efthomas

comments.content: is very close to Fritz Quadrata, maybe squished a little or something
Friz Quadrata has an open P and R. And there are some other differences. So, that’s not it.
And the E varies as well.

Very close to Letterhead fonts’ Kellie Ann:

[http://letterheadfonts.com/fonts/kellieann.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145715/http:/letterheadfonts.com/fonts/kellieann.shtml "http://letterheadfonts.com/fonts/kellieann.shtml")
Hah! I just noticed that in this [other thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705145715/http:/typophile.com/node/35295)! :^D Two birds with one stone.
